Historically, Syria, or The Levant as the region has sometimes been called in English, has often been taken to include the territories of Lebanon, Israel and the Palestinian Territories, and parts of Jordan, but excluding the Jazira region in the north-east of the modern Syrian state.
In this historic sense, the region is also known as Greater Syria or by the Arabic name Bilad al-Sham (بلاد الشام).
